<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-30"><a href="#Interpreter"><span class="tocnumber">3</span> <span class="toctext">Interpreter</span></a></li>
</ul>
</div>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Semantics">Semantics</span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Execution">Execution</span></h3>
<p>Sclipting is stack-based. Most instructions execute by popping a certain number of elements from the stack and pushing a result. Some instructions, however, operate on the top item without popping it. Yet other instructions may shuffle the stack around almost arbitrarily.
</p><p>At the begining of the program, the input (e.g. STDIN) is placed on the stack as a single string.
</p><p>At the end of execution, the 併 instruction is executed once, which generates a string from all or part of the stack contents. This string then forms the program’s output.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Byte-array_literals">Byte-array literals</span></h3>
<p>The most common literal in Sclipting is the byte array (also called a buffer). It is encoded in the source as a sequence of Hangeul syllables in the following way:
</p>
<ul><li>Encode three bytes at a time. Three bytes are 24 bits. Take the first 12 bits and add U+AC00 (that’s your first character), then the rest and add U+AC00 (that’s the second character). If the byte array length is divisible by 3, you are done.</li>
<li>If there is one byte left, encode it in a single character by shifting it left by 4 bits and adding U+AC00.</li>
<li>If there are two bytes left, generate the first character from the first 12 bits the same way as above, while the second character is U+BC00 plus the remaining 4 bits of the second byte.</li></ul>
<p>Examples:
</p>
<table style="border-collapse: collapse">
<tbody><tr>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Example input
</th>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Sclipting byte-array literal
</th></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">00
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">가<br/>U+AC00
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">2A 2F
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">꺢및<br/>U+AEA2 U+BC0F
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">2A 2F 00
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">꺢묀<br/>U+AEA2 U+BB00
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">“Sclipting” in UTF-8<br/>53 63 6C 69 70 74 69 6E 67
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">넶꽬늗건늖멧<br/>U+B136 U+AF6C U+B297 U+AC74 U+B296 U+BA67
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">“ДЖ” in UTF-16 (Little Endian)<br/>14 04 16 04
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">굀뀖걀<br/>U+AD40 U+B016 U+AC40
</td></tr></tbody></table>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Number_literals">Number literals</span></h3>
<p>Positive numbers are expressed as a (big-endian) byte array. This allows arbitrary-size integers.
</p><p>7076 Hangeul syllables can be used to express a negative integer (U+BC00 = −1 to U+D7A3 = −7076). The range overlaps with that used by byte array literals, but there is no ambiguity because byte array literals always <i>start</i> with a character in the range U+AC00-U+BBFF. Thus, if the program contains a U+BC0x with no character in that range preceding it, it encodes a negative number.
</p><p>If you need a negative number less than −7076, write it as a positive number and then negate it.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Data_types">Data types</span></h3>
<p>Sclipting knows the following data types:
</p>
<ul><li><b>Byte array:</b> A sequence of bytes of a certain length.</li>
<li><b>String:</b> A sequence of Unicode characters of a certain length.</li>
<li><b>Integer:</b> An arbitrary-size signed integer.</li>
<li><b>Float:</b> A double-precision (IEEE) floating-point number. Possible values include ±∞ and NaN.</li>
<li><b>List:</b> A list of items of a certain length. Each item can be of any of these datatypes, including another list.</li>
<li><b>Mark:</b> A special item (generated by 標) that marks a position in the stack (and occupies a stack slot of its own). Currently only 并 and 併 make use of this.</li>
<li><b>Function:</b> An anonymous function (lambda) that can be pushed to and popped from the stack and executed.</li></ul>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Conversions">Conversions</span></h3>
<p>The following describes <i>implicit conversions</i> that are performed by instructions that expect a certain input data type. However, some instructions may override some of the behaviours described here.
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Conversion_to_byte_array">Conversion to byte array</span></h4>
<p>Items never convert implicitly to a byte array. Instructions that generate byte arrays specify in their documentation how they generate it.
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Conversion_to_string">Conversion to string</span></h4>
<ul><li><b>Byte arrays</b> are decoded as UTF-8.</li>
<li><b>Integers/floats</b> are rendered into strings by using the invariant culture.</li>
<li><b>Lists</b> are converted to strings by converting each element to a string and concatenating them all. If the list contains further lists, this applies recursively.</li>
<li><b>Marks</b> and <b>functions</b> convert to the empty string.</li></ul>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Conversion_to_integer">Conversion to integer</span></h4>
<ul><li><b>Byte arrays</b> are assumed to be in big-endian order and converted to a positive integer as if it were a base-256 number.</li>
<li><b>Floats</b> are rounded toward 0. The floats ±∞ and NaN are all converted to 0.</li>
<li><b>Strings</b> are parsed as integers (in decimal) using the invariant culture. If the string is not a valid integer, it is converted to 0.</li>
<li><b>Lists</b> are converted to integers by converting each element to an integer and then computing the sum. If the list contains further lists, this applies recursively. If any item in the structure is a float, the sum operation is floating-point and the resulting float is then converted to an integer.</li>
<li><b>Marks</b> and <b>functions</b> are converted to 0.</li></ul>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Conversion_to_float">Conversion to float</span></h4>
<p>All items that aren’t already floats convert to a float in the same way that they convert to integers, except of course that the result of a list sum is not rounded.
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Conversion_to_list">Conversion to list</span></h4>
<p>Items never convert implicitly to a list. Instructions that operate on lists or iterate over them specify in their documentation what they do when the input is not a list.
</p><p>Many list operations convert any non-list to a string and then operate on that as if it were a list of characters; however, they generally return the result as a string, not a list of characters. This difference is significant: when converting to an integer, the string “47” converts to 47, but the list { “4”, “7” } converts to 4 + 7 = 11.
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Booleans">Booleans</span></h4>
<p>Some instructions treat an item as a boolean. These generally convert them to an integer and then compare against 0. 0 is considered <i>false</i>, everything else <i>true</i>. Note this has the following consequences:
</p>
<ul><li>All floats greater than -1 and less than 1 are considered <i>false</i>, as are NaN and ±∞.</li>
<li>Almost all strings are <i>false</i>. The only strings that are <i>true</i> are those that encode a valid non-zero integer.</li>
<li>A list containing items that add up to 0 is also considered <i>false</i>, even if those items are not themselves all <i>false</i> (for example, the list { −1, 1 }).</li></ul>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Instructions">Instructions</span></h3>
<p>Syntactically, there are four types of instructions:
</p>
<ul><li><b>Singular instruction:</b> A singular instruction is a lexical unit. The instruction syntactically stands by itself and does not form a structure with other instructions. Every instruction that is not explicitly marked otherwise is a singular instruction.</li>
<li><b>Block head instruction:</b> These instructions start a <i>block</i>, which is a nested sequence of instructions that may be executed conditionally or repeatedly. The block must ultimately be terminated by a <i>block-end</i> instruction (終), although there may be multiple blocks separated by a <i>condition-block</i> instruction (況) or an <i>else</i> instruction (不 or 逆).</li>
<li><b>Condition-block instruction:</b> The 況 instruction can be used to specify code to execute at the beginning of every iteration of a <i>while</i> loop (generally used to compute a terminating condition). This instruction terminates the condition block and starts the primary block. For example, in the code 套 <i>c</i> 況 <i>p</i> 不 <i>e</i> 終, the <i>c</i> block is executed at the beginning of every iteration; <i>p</i> is the primary block, only executed if <i>c</i> returned <i>true</i>; and <i>e</i> is the <i>else</i> block, only executed if <i>c</i> returned <i>false</i> already in the first iteration.</li>
<li><b>Else-block instruction:</b> Most block instructions may have an <i>else</i> block which executes only if the first block was not executed. A block instruction is allowed to have such an <i>else</i> block unless explicitly stated otherwise. The <i>else</i> instruction terminates the primary block and starts the <i>else</i> block, which must be terminated by the <i>block-end</i> instruction (終).</li>
<li><b>Block-end instruction:</b> The 終 instruction, which lexically terminates a block.</li></ul>
<p>It is a compile-time error to have a block head instruction or an <i>else</i> instruction without a matching <i>end</i> instruction.
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Block_structure">Block structure</span></h4>
<table style="border-collapse: collapse">
<tbody><tr>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Sclipting
</th>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Unicode
</th>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Engrish
</th>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Meaning
</th></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">況
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+6CC1
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">condition
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">Marks the lexical end of a block that computes a terminating condition and the start of the primary block. This can only be used with one of the <i>while</i> loops (套/要/迄/到/滿/充).
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">不
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+4E0D
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">no
</td>
<td rowspan="2" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">Marks the lexical end of a block and the start of a new block which is executed only if the first block wasn’t. In general, the difference is that 不 pops an item and 逆 doesn’t, but the exact semantics depend on the block’s head instruction.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">逆
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+9006
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">opposite
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">終
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+7D42
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">end
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">Marks the lexical end of a block. An item may be pushed depending on the block’s head instruction.
</td></tr></tbody></table>

</td>

<h5><span class="mw-headline" id="Additional_stack_manipulation_instructions">Additional stack manipulation instructions</span></h5>
<table style="border-collapse: collapse">
<tbody><tr>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Sclipting
</th>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Unicodes
</th>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Meaning
</th></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">① ... ⑳,<br/>㉑ ... ㉟,<br/>㊱ ... ㊿
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+2460 .. U+2473,<br/>U+3251 .. U+325F,<br/>U+32B1 .. U+32BF
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">Pushes a copy of the item at the specified location from the <i>bottom</i> of the stack (1-based counting).
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">❶ ... ❿,<br/>⓫ ... ⓴
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+2776 .. U+277F,<br/>U+24EB .. U+24F4
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">Pushes a copy of the item at the specified location from the <i>top</i> of the stack (1-based counting).
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">⑴ ... ⒇
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+2474 .. U+2487
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">Moves the item at the specified location from the <i>bottom</i> of the stack (1-based counting) to the top.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">⓵ ... ⓾
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+24F5 .. U+24FE
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">Moves the item at the specified location from the <i>top</i> of the stack (1-based counting) to the top. Note this implies ⓵ is a no-op.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">⒈ ... ⒛
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+2488 .. U+249B
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">Swaps the item at the specified location from the <i>bottom</i> of the stack with the top item.
</td></tr></tbody></table>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Loops_and_conditionals">Loops and conditionals</span></h4>
<p>The instructions listed in this table are all block instructions which cause their associated block to be executed conditionally or repeatedly. Block instructions in this list may optionally have either type of <i>else</i> block unless explicitly stated otherwise.
</p><p>Where these descriptions describe an item as <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>, they refer to the boolean value of an item as described in the section “Conversions”. An item is <i>empty</i> if it is either the empty list, or it is not a list and converts to the empty string. This means the mark (標) is <i>empty</i>, but integers and floats are not.
</p>
<table style="border-collapse: collapse">
<tbody><tr>

<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">是
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+662F
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">yes
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(X) → ()
</td>
<td rowspan="6" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top"><b>If:</b> Executes the block only if the top item is <i>true</i> (是/倘), <i>false</i> (沒/毋)  or <i>non-empty</i> (夠/含). 是/沒/夠 pop the item while 倘/毋/含 do not. If the item is <i>false</i>/<i>true</i>/<i>empty</i> and there is an <i>else</i> block, the <i>else</i> instruction overrides the popping behaviour.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">倘

</td>

</td></tr>

<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">夠

<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">enough

<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">含

<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+542B

<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">contain

<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(X) → (X)
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">套
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+5957
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">loop
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(X) → ()
</td>
<td rowspan="6" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top"><b>While loop:</b> Repeatedly, 1. if there is a condition block (況), it is executed; 2. the top item is popped (套/迄/滿) or merely examined (要/到/充); 3. the primary block is executed if the item is <i>true</i> (套/要)/<i>false</i> (迄/到)/<i>non-empty</i> (滿/充). This is repeated until the item is <i>false</i> (套/要)/<i>true</i> (迄/到)/<i>empty</i> (滿/充). If the first item examined is already <i>false</i> (套/要)/<i>true</i> (迄/到)/<i>empty</i> (滿/充), and there is an <i>else</i> block, the <i>else</i> block is executed and its instruction overrides the popping behaviour.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">要
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+8981
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">necessity
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(X) → (X)
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">迄
</td>

<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">until

</td></tr>

<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(X) → (X)

<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">滿
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+6EFF
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">full
</td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">充
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+5145
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">be full
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(X) → (X)
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">上
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+4E0A
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">up
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(I, I) → (I)
</td>
<td rowspan="2" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top"><b>For loop:</b> Pops two integers <i>start</i> and <i>end</i> and iterates over the integers in that range. The integer <i>start</i> is pushed and the block executed. Then <i>start</i> + 1 (上) or <i>start</i> − 1 (下) is pushed and the block executed again, etc. The block is executed a total of <i>end</i> − <i>start</i> + 1 (上)/<i>start</i> − <i>end</i> + 1 (下) times. There may be a 不 block that is executed if <i>end</i> &lt; <i>start</i> (上)/<i>end</i> &gt; <i>start</i> (下). A 逆 block is not allowed.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">下
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+4E0B
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">down
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(I, I) → (I)
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">各
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+5404
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">each
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(X) → (X)
</td>
<td rowspan="2" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top"><b>For-each loop:</b> Iterates over the items in a list, the characters in a string, or the bytes in a byte array. 各 pops the item while 每 does not. Each item is pushed and the block executed. If the list is empty and there is an <i>else</i> block, the <i>else</i> instruction overrides the popping behaviour. (If the top item is a byte array containing UTF-8 text and you wish to iterate over the characters, you will have to convert it to a string first, e.g. by using 併.)
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">每
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+6BCF
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">every
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(X) → (X, X)
</td></tr></tbody></table>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Arithmetic">Arithmetic</span></h4>
<p>These instructions generally take integers or floats as arguments. When they encounter any other datatype, they will convert items to floats or integers as described in the section “Conversions”. In the following descriptions, “number” (and N in the stack transition) means “integer or float”. If the description and stack transition mention only “integer”, floats are accepted but are rounded toward zero.
</p><p>Divisions by zero (including modulo zero) return NaN.
</p>

</th>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Meaning
</th></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">加

</td>

<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top"><b>Addition:</b> Pops <i>a</i> and <i>b</i> and pushes <i>a</i> + <i>b</i>.
</td></tr>

</td></tr>

</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(N, N) → (N)

</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top"><b>Float division:</b> Pops <i>a</i> and <i>b</i> and pushes <i>a</i> ÷ <i>b</i> as a float, even if both operands are integers.
</td></tr>

<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">分

</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top"><b>Integer division:</b> Pops integers <i>a</i> and <i>b</i> and pushes <i>a</i> ÷ <i>b</i> as an integer that is rounded toward 0.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">剩

</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top"><b>Modulo:</b> Pops <i>a</i> and <i>b</i> and pushes the remainder. The result is always between 0 and <i>b </i>−<i> </i>1, even if <i>a</i> is negative.
</td></tr>

</td></tr>

</td></tr>

</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top"><b>Exponentiation:</b> Pops <i>a</i> and <i>b</i> and pushes <i>a</i><sup><i>b</i></sup>. If <i>a</i> is an integer and <i>b</i> is a non-negative integer, the result is an integer, otherwise a float.
</td></tr>

<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top"><b>Square:</b> Pops <i>a</i> and pushes <i>a</i>².
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">根
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+6839
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">root
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(N) → (N)
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top"><b>Square root:</b> Pops <i>a</i> and pushes √<i>a</i>.
</td></tr>

<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">左
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+5DE6
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">left

</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top"><b>Shift left:</b> Pops <i>a</i> and <i>b</i> and pushes <i>a</i> <span style="font-variant: small-caps">&lt;&lt;</span> <i>b</i>. <i>b</i> can be negative in which case <i>a</i> is shifted to the right instead.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">右

</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top"><b>Shift right:</b> Pops <i>a</i> and <i>b</i> and pushes <i>a</i> <span style="font-variant: small-caps">&gt;&gt;</span> <i>b</i>. <i>b</i> can be negative in which case <i>a</i> is shifted to the left instead.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">雙

</td></tr>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">啃
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+5543
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">gnaw
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(I, I) → (I, I)
</td>
<td rowspan="2" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top"><b>Bit split:</b> Pops <i>a</i> and <i>b</i>. Let <i>c</i> = <i>a</i> &amp; ~(−1 &lt;&lt; <i>b</i>) (the bottom <i>b</i> bits of <i>a</i>) and <i>d</i> = <i>a</i> &gt;&gt; <i>b</i> (the rest of the number). 啃 pushes <i>c</i> then <i>d</i>; 嚙 pushes <i>d</i> then <i>c</i>.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">嚙

</td></tr>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Logic">Logic</span></h4>
<p>These instructions generally deal with boolean logic. Descriptions that refer to <i>true</i> or <i>false</i> refer to the boolean value of an item as described in “Conversions”.
</p>
<table style="border-collapse: collapse">
<tbody><tr>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Sclipting
</th>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Unicode
</th>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Engrish
</th>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Stack transition
</th>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Meaning
</th></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">小
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+5C0F
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">small
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(N, N) → (I)
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top"><b>Less than:</b> Pops <i>a</i> and <i>b</i> and pushes 1 if <i>a</i> &lt; <i>b</i>, otherwise 0.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">大
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+5927
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">great
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(N, N) → (I)
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top"><b>Greater than:</b> Pops <i>a</i> and <i>b</i> and pushes 1 if <i>a</i> &gt; <i>b</i>, otherwise 0.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">少
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+5C11
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">less
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(N, N) → (I)
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top"><b>Less than or equal to:</b> Pops <i>a</i> and <i>b</i> and pushes 1 if <i>a</i> ≤ <i>b</i>, otherwise 0.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">瀰
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+7030
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">overflow
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(N, N) → (I)
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top"><b>Greater than or equal to:</b> Pops <i>a</i> and <i>b</i> and pushes 1 if <i>a</i> ≥ <i>b</i>, otherwise 0.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">同
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+540C
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">same
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(X, X) → (I)
</td>
<td rowspan="2" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top"><b>Equality:</b> Pops two items and pushes 1 (同)/0 (差) if they are exactly the same thing (integer 0, float 0, character ‘0’ and byte array 0x00 are considered different), otherwise 0 (同)/1 (差).
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">差
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+5DEE
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">different
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(X, X) → (I)
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">侔
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+4F94
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">equal
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(I, I) → (I)
</td>
<td rowspan="2" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top"><b>Integer equality:</b> Pops two items and pushes 1 (侔)/0 (异) if they convert to the same integer, otherwise pushes 0 (侔)/1 (异).
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">异
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+5F02
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">different
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(I, I) → (I)
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">肖
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+8096
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">resemble
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(S, S) → (I)
</td>
<td rowspan="2" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top"><b>String equality:</b> Pops two items and pushes 1 (肖)/0 (殊) if they convert to the same string, otherwise pushes 0 (肖)/1 (殊).
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">殊
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+6B8A
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">different
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(S, S) → (I)
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">與
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+8207
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">and
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(I, I) → (I)
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top"><b>Logical <span style="font-variant: small-caps">and</span>:</b> Pops <i>a</i> and <i>b</i> and pushes 1 if both are non-zero, otherwise 0.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">或
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+6216
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">or
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(I, I) → (I)
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top"><b>Logical <span style="font-variant: small-caps">or</span>:</b> Pops <i>a</i> and <i>b</i> and pushes 1 if either or both are non-zero, otherwise 0.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">隻
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+96BB
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">one of pair
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(I, I) → (I)
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top"><b>Logical <span style="font-variant: small-caps">xor</span>:</b> Pops <i>a</i> and <i>b</i> and pushes 1 if one is non-zero (but not both), otherwise 0.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">非
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+975E
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">not
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(I) → (I)
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top"><b>Logical <span style="font-variant: small-caps">not</span>:</b> Pops <i>a</i> and pushes 1 if <i>a</i> is 0, otherwise 0.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">嗎
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+55CE
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">is it?
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(I, X, X) → (X)
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top"><b>Conditional operator:</b> Pops <i>q, y</i> and <i>n</i> and pushes <i>y</i> if <i>q</i> is non-zero, otherwise pushes <i>n</i>.
</td></tr></tbody></table>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Lambda_function_instructions">Lambda function instructions</span></h4>
<p>Instructions marked with a “█” are block head instructions; all others are singular instructions.
</p>
<table style="border-collapse: collapse">
<tbody><tr>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Block
</th>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Sclipting
</th>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Unicode
</th>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Engrish
</th>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Stack transition
</th>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Meaning
</th></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">█
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">塊
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+584A
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">block
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">() → (F)
</td>
<td rowspan="2" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">Introduces an anonymous function (lambda expression) consisting of the instructions within the block. The function is pushed onto the stack and not executed. 掳 additionally pops an item and stores it with the function; a copy of that item is pushed every time the function starts to execute.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">█
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">掳
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+63B3
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">capture
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(X) → (F)
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">開
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+958B
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">initiate
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(F) → ()
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">Pops an item. If the item popped is a function, it is executed.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">辦
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+8FA6
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">handle
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(F) → (F)
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">Pops an item, executes it if it is a function, and then pushes it back.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">演
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+6F14
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">perform
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(F) → (F)
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">If the top item on the stack is a function, executes it without popping it. Note this means that the function will “see” itself on the stack.
</td></tr></tbody></table>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Lists_and_strings">Lists and strings</span></h4>
<p>These instructions all operate on a list or a string. Anything that is not a list or string is converted to a string as described in the section “Conversions”.
</p>
<h5><span class="mw-headline" id="Instructions_to_operate_on_a_specific_index">Instructions to operate on a specific index</span></h5>
<p>The following instructions all operate on a specific item in a list or character in a string, identified by an index counting either forward from the start or backward from the end of the list/string. The semantics of each instruction are the same as those listed under “see also” at the end of the table except that those take an index from the stack. 
</p>
<table style="border-collapse: collapse">
<tbody><tr>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Element
</th>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left"><div style="text-align: center">Retrieve (pop)</div>
</th>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left"><div style="text-align: center">Retrieve (no pop)</div>
</th>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left"><div style="text-align: center">Insert</div>
</th>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left"><div style="text-align: center">Delete</div>
</th>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left"><div style="text-align: center">Retrieve + delete</div>
</th>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left"><div style="text-align: center">Replace</div>
</th>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left"><div style="text-align: center">Exchange</div>
</th></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">first
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top"><div style="text-align: center">一</div><div style="text-align: center">U+4E00</div><div style="text-align: center">one</div>
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top"><div style="text-align: center">壹</div><div style="text-align: center">U+58F9</div><div style="text-align: center">one</div>

</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top"><div style="text-align: center">鈮</div><div style="text-align: center">U+922E</div><div style="text-align: center">niobium</div>

<h5><span id="Other_list.2Fstring_manipulation_instructions"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="Other_list/string_manipulation_instructions">Other list/string manipulation instructions</span></h5>
<p>Instructions in this table marked with a “█” are block head instructions; all others are singular instructions.
</p>
<table style="border-collapse: collapse">
<tbody><tr>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Block
</th>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Sclipting
</th>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Unicode
</th>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Engrish
</th>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Stack transition
</th>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Meaning
</th></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">掘
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+6398
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">excavate
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(X, I) → (X)
</td>
<td rowspan="4" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">Pushes the <i>i</i><sup>th</sup> (掘/挖) or <i>i</i><sup>th</sup>-last (掊/采) item/character within a list/string (starts at zero), or the empty string if <i>i</i> is out of range. 掘/掊 pop the list/string, 挖/采 do not.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">掊

</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(X, I) → (X)
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">

<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">栽
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+683D
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">cultivate
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(X, I, X) → (X)
</td>
<td rowspan="2" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">Inserts an item/character into a list/string at a specified forward (栽) or backward (種) index, shifting later items/characters to the right (padding as necessary).
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">種

</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(X, I, X) → (X)
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">殲
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+6BB2
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">annihilate
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(X, I) → (X)
</td>
<td rowspan="2" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">Deletes the <i>i</i><sup>th</sup> (殲) or <i>i</i><sup>th</sup>-last (摧) item/character within a list/string. If <i>i</i> is negative or out of range, nothing happens.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">摧
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+6467
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">destroy
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(X, I) → (X)
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">裒
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+88D2
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">take out
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(X, I) → (X, X)
</td>
<td rowspan="2" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">Pushes the <i>i</i><sup>th</sup> (裒) or <i>i</i><sup>th</sup>-last (抽) item/character within a list/string (starts at zero), or the empty string if <i>i</i> is out of range, and then removes that item/character from the list/string.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">抽
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+62BD
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">pull out
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(X, I) → (X, X)
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">插
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+63D2
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">insert
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(X, I, X) → (X)
</td>
<td rowspan="2" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">Replaces the <i>i</i><sup>th</sup> (插) or <i>i</i><sup>th</sup>-last (恢) item/character within a list/string with a new item (padding as necessary).
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">恢
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+6062
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">restore
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(X, I, X) → (X)
</td></tr>
<tr>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">█
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">折
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+6298
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">snap
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(X) → (X, X)
</td>
<td rowspan="4" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top"><b>Take-until/skip-until:</b> Splits a list or string into two as follows. Iterates over the items in a list or the characters in a string in forward (折/破) or backward (擘/断) order. Each item is pushed and the block executed; at the end of each iteration, an item is popped. If that item is <i>true</i>, the iteration is halted. At the end, two lists/strings are pushed: the original list or string, split at the position where the block returned <i>true</i>. 折/擘 pop the original list/string; 破/断 do not. If the list/string is empty and an <i>else</i> block exists, no results are pushed and the <i>else</i> instruction overrides the popping behaviour; however, if no <i>else</i> block exists, two empty lists/strings are pushed.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">█
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">破
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+7834
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">rupture
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(X) → (X, X, X)
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">█
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">擘
</td>

</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(X) → (X, X)
</td></tr>

<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top"><b>Join:</b> Concatenate all the strings in a list into a single string while interspersing them with the specified separator. If the input is not a list, it is converted to a string and the separator interspersed between every character.

</td>

</td></tr>

<h5><span id="String_manipulation_only_.28no_lists.29"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="String_manipulation_only_(no_lists)">String manipulation only (no lists)</span></h5>
<p>Sclipting has built-in support for regular expressions. All regular expression instructions in Sclipting default to the behaviour normally referred to as “single-line mode” (Perl modifier s), which means that the . operator matches any character. The behaviour can be altered within a regular expression by using the (?-s:...) construct to disable “single-line mode” (so . matches anything but newlines). The same construct can be used to enable “multi-line mode” (m; alters the meanings of ^ and $ to match the beginning/end of a line within the string instead of the beginning/end of the whole string), “ignore case” (i) and “ignore whitespace” (x).
</p><p>Instructions in this list marked with a “█” are block head instructions. Instructions marked with a “ʘ” can only be used within the main block of one of those block instructions. If several blocks are nested, the “ʘ” instructions apply only to the innermost block.
</p>
<table style="border-collapse: collapse">
<tbody><tr>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Block
</th>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Sclipting
</th>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Unicode

<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Engrish
</th>

</th>
<th style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; background: #eee; text-align: left">Meaning

<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+63DB

<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">substitute
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(S, S) → (S)
</td>
<td rowspan="12" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">Finds matches of a regular expression (換/代/替/更), a case-sensitive substring (取/挐/拿/拏) or a case-insensitive substring (用/喫/買/進) (top item) in a string (item below) and executes the block for the first match (換/代/取/挐/用/喫) or all matches (替/更/拿/拏/買/進) found. At the end of each iteration, the last item is popped and used as the replacement string for this match. After the last iteration, the string resulting from all those replacements is pushed. — The regular expression or substring is always popped. 換/替/取/拿/用/買 pop the input string as well, 代/更/挐/拏/喫/進 do not. If there is no match and there is an <i>else</i> block, the <i>else</i> block is executed. If it is a 不 block, the input string is popped, but is pushed back again at the end of the block. If it is a 逆 block, the input string is left alone and not popped or pushed.
</td></tr>

<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">坼

<td rowspan="2" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">Splits a string at every match of a regular expression and pushes the result as a list of strings. If the regular expression includes capturing parentheses, their matches are included in the list as well. The regular expression is always popped; 坼 pops the input string as well, 裂 does not.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">裂
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+88C2
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">split
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(S, S) → (S, L)
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">壯
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+58EF
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">big
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(S) → (S)
</td>
<td rowspan="3" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">Converts a string to upper-case (壯), lower-case (微) or title-case (題). If the item is a list, this operation is applied recursively to every element in the list.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">微
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+5FAE
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">tiny
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(S) → (S)
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">題
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+984C
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">title
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(S) → (S)
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">瘋
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+760B
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">crazy
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(I) → (S)
</td>
<td rowspan="2" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">Pushes a random string of the specified length. Characters are picked from the set a-z, A-Z (瘋) or a-z, A-Z, 0-9 (狂).
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">狂
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">U+72C2
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top">insane
</td>
<td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; padding: .1em 1em .1em .5em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap">(I) → (S)
</td></tr></tbody></table>
<h5><span class="mw-headline" id="Regular_expression_capturing_group_instructions">Regular expression capturing group instructions</span></h5>
<table style="border-collapse: collapse">

</td>

</td></tr></tbody></table>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Examples">Examples</span></h2>
<h3><span id="Hello.2C_World.21"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="Hello,_World!">Hello, World!</span></h3>
<pre style='font-family:"MS Mincho","Batang","Segoe UI",serif;font-size:100%'>丟낆녬닆묬긅덯댦롤긐
</pre>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="99_bottles_of_beer_on_the_wall">99 bottles of beer on the wall</span></h3>
<pre style='font-family:"MS Mincho","Batang","Segoe UI",serif;font-size:100%'>丟눰標下標❷❶냦및嗎긆깯덇끬뉐❷貶是댰終긆뭦긆깥뉗긠닶먠덆둥긇덡닆렬겠
併標❸❶냦및嗎긆깯덇끬뉐❷貶是댰終긆뭦긆깥뉗긮겠併❸녆굫뉒걯닦넠뉆뭷닢렠댆굳댲걩덂걡댦뭵닦뀬겠
⓵끶묠덆묠덆둥긇꽴닷깥껂걢덗딠댶뭭뉒걭닷깥껀밊嗎⓸倘貶不꾓밉終倘긆깯덇끬뉐
❷貶是댰終不냦묠눦뭴덆롥댰終긆뭦긆깥뉗긠닶먠덆둥긇덡닆렮겠밊終
</pre>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Interpreter">Interpreter</span></h2>
<ul><li>Sclipting is implemented in <a class="external text" href="https://github.com/Timwi/EsotericIDE" rel="nofollow">Esoteric IDE</a>.</li></ul>

<div class="mw-content-ltr mw-parser-output" dir="ltr" lang="en"><p><b>Shove</b> is an <a href="/wiki/Esoteric_programming_language" title="Esoteric programming language">esoteric programming language</a> created by <a href="/wiki/User:Ais523" title="User:Ais523">User:ais523</a> in <a href="/wiki/Category:2008" title="Category:2008">2008</a>, but ais523 forgot to tell anyone about it until <a href="/wiki/Category:2013" title="Category:2013">2013</a>. It is based on the idea of "shoving" <a href="/wiki/String" title="String">strings</a> into a self-modifying, two-dimensional program, pushing other content out of the way.
</p>
<div aria-labelledby="mw-toc-heading" class="toc" id="toc" role="navigation"><input class="toctogglecheckbox" id="toctogglecheckbox" role="button" style="display:none" type="checkbox"/><div class="toctitle" dir="ltr" lang="en"><h2 id="mw-toc-heading">Contents</h2><span class="toctogglespan"><label class="toctogglelabel" for="toctogglecheckbox"></label></span></div>
<ul>
<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-1"><a href="#Specification"><span class="tocnumber">1</span> <span class="toctext">Specification</span></a>
<ul>
<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-2"><a href="#Shoving"><span class="tocnumber">1.1</span> <span class="toctext">Shoving</span></a></li>
<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-3"><a href="#Instructions"><span class="tocnumber">1.2</span> <span class="toctext">Instructions</span></a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-4"><a href="#Example"><span class="tocnumber">2</span> <span class="toctext">Example</span></a>
<ul>
<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-5"><a href="#Hello,_World!"><span class="tocnumber">2.1</span> <span class="toctext">Hello, World!</span></a></li>
<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-6"><a href="#Looping_counter"><span class="tocnumber">2.2</span> <span class="toctext">Looping counter</span></a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-7"><a href="#External_resources"><span class="tocnumber">3</span> <span class="toctext">External resources</span></a></li>
</ul>
</div>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Specification">Specification</span></h2>
<p>A Shove program is the initial state of a two-dimensional playfield of cells containing characters, in which execution may pass in any of the four cardinal directions.
</p><p>At the start of execution the instruction pointer begins on the leftmost cell of the topmost line of the program, moving rightwards until some instruction causes its direction to change.  Execution halts when the instruction pointer passes beyond the boundary of the current playfield, so that no further instructions to execute can be reached.
</p><p>Shove has a <a href="/wiki/Stack" title="Stack">stack</a>, to which <a href="/wiki/String" title="String">strings</a> may be pushed from the playfield, or from which they may be popped, shoving them into the playfield.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Shoving">Shoving</span></h3>
<p>When a string is shoved into the playfield, its first character is put into a specific neighboring cell of the currently running instruction.  Further characters of the string are placed relative to the first, in the current execution direction.  This does <i>not</i> overwrite any characters, instead an entire ray of characters, from the starting cell and onwards in the current execution direction, is shoved out of the way to make room for the new characters.
</p><p>In the case where the currently executing character is one of those shoved, so is the instruction pointer, so that execution continues from after the new position of that character.
</p><p>The process of shoving may enlarge the boundaries of the playfield in any direction.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Instructions">Instructions</span></h3>
<table class="wikitable plainpres">
<tbody><tr>
<th>Commands</th>
<th>Description
</th></tr>
<tr>
<td><code>' "</code>
</td>
<td>Push a string from the playfield onto the stack.  The string is read in the current execution direction and ends before the matching <code>'</code> or <code>"</code>, respectively, after which execution continues.  <code>'</code> quoted strings may be nested inside <code>"</code> quoted strings and vice versa, to unlimited depth.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><code>&lt; v &gt; ^</code>
</td>
<td>Change direction of execution to the one pointed to.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><code>A V ( )</code>
</td>
<td>Pop a string from the stack and shove it onto the playfield, starting at the neighboring cell in the direction pointed to.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><code style="white-space:pre"> </code> (space)
</td>
<td>Do nothing.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><code>!</code>
</td>
<td>Do nothing.  This also signals to the implementation that any characters behind the instruction pointer (the entire half-plane in the direction it is coming from) will never again be used.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><code>S</code>
</td>
<td>In implementations with output, print the string at the top of the stack, without popping it.  Otherwise do nothing.
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><code>n</code>
</td>
<td>In implementations with output, print a newline.  Otherwise do nothing.
</td></tr></tbody></table>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Example">Example</span></h2>
<h3><span id="Hello.2C_World.21"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="Hello,_World!"><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Hello,_World!" title="Hello, World!">Hello, World!</a></span></h3>
<pre>" ,olleH"V       v
 S"!dlroW"&lt;
</pre>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Looping_counter"><a href="/wiki/Looping_counter" title="Looping counter">Looping counter</a></span></h3>
<pre>&gt;"*"V" ")v
^nS""    &lt;
</pre>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="External_resources">External resources</span></h2>
<ul><li><a class="external text" href="http://nethack4.org/esolangs/shove.pl" rel="nofollow">Original implementation</a> in Perl.</li>
<li><a class="external text" href="http://oerjan.nvg.org/esoteric/shove/shove" rel="nofollow">Slightly modified implementation</a> with some command line options.</li></ul>
